sections.title: Overheating
sections.content:
There are some discussions concerning overheating-related shutdowns when running under full load (video encoding, etc). [1] [2]

Use the following thinkfanAUR configuration [3]:

```
/etc/thinkfan.conf
```

```
#X201 user specific
#lvl    low     up      RPM
(0,    0,      47)     # 0
(1,    42,     57)     # 2000
(2,    44,     59)     # 3300
(3,    50,     65)     # 3500
(4,    54,     70)     # 3500
(5,    60,     73)     # 3800
(6,    62,     83)     # 3800
(7,    65,     88)     # 4300
(127,  70,     32767)  # 5300
```

cpupower can be used for frequency scaling; see CPU frequency scaling for more information. Undervolting is not possible with the Intel core iX cpu.

sections.title: No speaker output
sections.content: Try pressing the mute button (next to the Escape key). See this article for details.

sections.title: Display issues
sections.content:
See Intel graphics#AccelMethod and Intel graphics#DRI3 issues.

X201s: If planning to use VT-d, it is also recommended to add the following kernel parameter:

```
intel_iommu=igfx_off
```

sections.title: Hardware virtualization
sections.content: If KVM claims virtualization support is disabled in BIOS, even with VT-x enabled, disable Intel TXT. [6]
